result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Germayne Merkeys Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor appeared by video.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Germayne Merkeys Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

OFF RECORD - Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Germayne Merkeys Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense is requesting a status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PWW.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Germayne Merkeys Taylor in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
